choices.D: Monitor auto-scaling events for the next 24 hours.
choices.C: Review auto-scaling policies to detect a misconfiguration.
choices.B: Review the load balancer configuration settings.
choices.A: Add more systems into the scaling group.

questions.question_text:
While reviewing the auto-scaling events for a web application, a cloud engineer identified that the application upsized and downsized multiple times within the last hour.
Which of the following should the cloud engineer do NEXT?

discussion.content: C is better. Key word "Review auto-scaling".

comments.content: The anomaly is CPU utilization jumping from 20% to 70%

discussion.content: iSCSI is storage so should it not be A? Isnâ€™t 5ms to 25ms disk latency something to investigate?

going with B.

There's a clear spike in the CPU utilization happening on Tuesday which if you plot the data, can be interpreted as an anomaly.

Ram will be a trend and not an anomaly.

comments.content: But it's not an anomaly which is what the questions i asking. B makes more sense.

discussion.content: Right answer is D, memory utilization is increasing with time
it is B and D for me

It's B/D "use their own identity stores". This apps wants customers to be able to sign in with their Facebook or Google or eamil (etc). This requires federation. B&D
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/external-identities/identity-providers

AB
use their own identity stores within the authentication process --> not D
CEF not related to the concern

questions.question_text:
A cloud application development team needs to consider the following requirements to the built in as part of the application's authentication process:
- Customers should have the flexibility to use their own identity stores within the authentication process.
- Customers should not be asked to provide the credentials repeatedly for different applications with different permission sets.
Which of the following solutions would BEST help the team achieve the above business objectives? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
a configuration management tool will allow the administrator to update the automation scripts and deploy the right server configuration. it takes away human error.

C. Configuration tools.
I'd go with C as D would be only when deploying new servers.
It says "minimize administration resources", I would go with D "minimize administration resources"
C is definitely the right answer - no doubt about it

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator notices one of the servers is using the wrong set of NTP servers. The administrator needs to avoid the same issue in the future but needs to minimize administration resources. Which of the following tools should a cloud administrator deploy to meet this requirement?

choices.B: Dual VPN connections over a single ISP from headquarters to one cloud region.
choices.A: Dual direct peering/connections from headquarters to one cloud region.
choices.D: Dual direct peering/connections over a single ISP from headquarters to both cloud regions
choices.C: Dual VPN connections over two separate ISPs from headquarters to both cloud regions.

questions.question_text:
To enhance availability, a company has expanded its public cloud presence to multiple regions from a single CSP. The company wants to ensure resources in the public cloud are highly available to users at company headquarters.
Which of the following is the BEST solution to fulfill this requirement?
